intro: Dasycondylus lobbii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Dasycondylus lobbii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
